author: phasemj58
title: Poor ongoing experience at Airbes Road Centre
body:
My mother has been in the care of Strathclyde Ward now for over three weeks for a critical care assessment. The handover between Wishaw General to Airbles Road Centre regarding her transfer was non-existent, and nearly resulted in my mother being discharged back home without an appropriate care package in place.  
My experience of the nursing staff at Strathclyde Ward differs wildly from my interactions with the staff at Wishaw General. The staff at Wishaw were all welcoming and very approachable, regardless of how busy the ward was (Ward 9). Not my experience on the Strathclyde Ward.  
The nursing station on the Strathclyde appears to turn into a staff room at visiting times, with staff congregating around it. Do the staff have nothing to do during visiting hours? It is certainly not approachable and certainly not welcoming. In fact, this set up is very off-putting when family members are looking to discuss the progress of their loved ones.  
There have also been a number of other smaller issues regarding my mum's care which I raised today with the ward manager, but on reflection I am very disappointed and dissatisfied with the discussion.  
My mum has fallen twice now whilst she has been on this ward. Luckily, she didn’t injure herself. The other day, I was met with a horrendous smell in the ward when I visited her. The smell was coming from a bowl of rotten melon which I had took in for my mum two days earlier. The bowl of fruit was still sitting on my mum's table, fermenting away, covered in mould. This confirmed what I suspected from the moment she arrived on this ward, a lack of care and attention.  
I feel there is a toxic culture in this unit which needs to be called out. I really want my mum out of this environment as soon as possible, but we await the care package, which could take weeks.

author: SinJin
title: Released feeling good again
body: At work and had an asthma attack. Ambulance arrived 25 min wait. Stabilised me and took me to hospital. Attended to and admitted 18hrs later. I spent 2 days and was released feeling good again. Thank you.

links.id: they made time for me every time

author: stace101
title: Experience in Maternal Fetal Assessment Unit (MAFU)
body: Had an appointment with Maternal Fetal Assessment Unit (MFAU) today, the staff were so lovely including the student midwife. Very professional and a lovely relaxed atmosphere!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Betrx75
title: Wonderful team
body:
I attended Grantham hospital this morning for my outpatient hysteroscopy one very anxious patient in their fifties, after researching online what to expect I had terrified myself (my last one a few years ago was under GA)  
I was seen on time, after been checked in by a friendly receptionist and directed to the waiting room.  
I was taken into the consulting room and immediately put at ease by SR Palmer who was going to carry out the procedure. She went through all that would happen and my medical history and concerns, making sure I was happy to go ahead with it. Emma and Tina who were assisting her were equally caring and compassionate towards me, I felt safe and confident to go ahead with the procedure and in the knowledge it would be stopped at anytime if I felt the pain was to much.  
The whole procedure was so much less painful than I had ever imagined. After an internal examination a speculum was inserted then the flexible hysterscope and saline, I felt some light cramping, then it was all over in no time. The nurses were by my side throughout.  
Afterwards I dressed and SR Palmer went through the findings. They all made sure I was ok before I left.  
I hope this gives some reassurance to anyone who felt like I did before this procedure.  
A big Thank You to this wonderful Team.

author: giftcf78
title: Frustrating visit to A&E
body:
I visited the GP in the morning. I had fallen and landed on my back at the start of December. Over the week it had gotten worse. The GP had made arrangements with minor injuries for an x-ray at 6:00pm. At 5:00pm I was contacted and asked to go to A&E who would be expecting me - no reason given.  
I arrived at about 5:15pm and spoke to receptionist who had no idea of me coming spent a few minutes trying to find out why I was there? I explained to the receptionist and the rest of A&E that I had seen the GP etc. So from having an appointment to go and sit down and wait. I waited and waited. After 2 hours I saw triage 1, had my blood pressure taken again and was told to sit and wait. Where I couldn't help but listen to everyone's personal business as to why they were there, confidentially nonexistent.  
While waiting I felt very hot and dizzy I knew I was going to faint as I slid of the seat on to the floor and lay there for approximately 20 mins. Not a soul came to help me. Eventually I made it back to my seat.  
During my next 2 hour wait I saw triage 2 who banged out their orders and asked me why I was there. I again explained my story. The nurse asked if I had taken meds, I explained only what doctor had given me in the morning 1 tramadol. They asked several times if I was sure. They then left the room and came back with medication handed me a plastic pot and water and a number of pain-killers. I explained I didn't take one of them as it affected my stomach, well don't take them then they said. I was given water and I took the others that were left. Then I was told to sit back in the waiting room.  
I waited till approximately 10:30 when I was called to see doctor who took my story again. They felt my back and said there didn't appear to be to much pain as I had felt him when he examined me. I told him I don't take medication unless necessary for blood pressure. I can't feel anything since I was given PK that make me sick, faint in fact, made me ill. I was told to go home and rest at approximately 11:00pm. After sitting in constant pain and discomfort for 6 hrs to be given a cocktail of drugs and then see a doctor. My symptoms were weakness, fainting and being sick. I was disorientated, confused and was told to go home and exercise and keep moving .  
I realise that staff are busy but these people seem to be desensitised. There was no confidentially. The place is unkempt (people not putting rubbish in bins provides). The chairs are inappropriate for people sitting for hours. I have always supported medical staff but this was not a good visit

author: KB33
title: Excellent GP service
body: I contacted the Duty GP at Pentland Medical Centre regarding a medical query for my teenage son. The service was excellent with a thorough discussion over the phone with antibiotics prescribed that afternoon. Great and efficient service.

author: nadia95
title: A really positive experience
body:
I would like to thank all the staff involved in the safe delivery of my baby girl at the beginning of December 2022.  
I was induced on ward 72. Every staff member was kind and helpful even when they were so busy - especially midwives Annie, Hannah and Emily who I was cared for over the course of my induction. I am so grateful for and won’t forget the care and reassurance given by Emily after my labour sped up unexpectedly. It made such a difference to how I felt and my experience as a first time mum.  
The midwives who delivered my baby and looked after me in the delivery room were also brilliant and made me feel safe and reassured by explaining what was happening at each stage, I then had lots of time with my baby and partner before being moved on to the ward.  
I also would like to thank Doctor David who I was seen by in the delivery suite. He took his time talking to us and had a great manner which we really appreciated - I’m sure he was being rushed off his feet behind the scenes but he never showed this once.  
All in, I had a really positive experience at the PRM and I am very grateful to the all the staff from the maternity assessment to the post natal ward who made my experience this way.

author: Mags01
title: Ward Bingo
body:
Background – My brother, suffers from COPD and is currently receiving palliative care with continuous oxygen and care at home. He lives on his own and depends on the support of myself, my daughter and his care package to help maintain some form of normality.Beginning of November 2022 – My brother was found collapsed at home on this date. We called for ambulance on 999 and he was sent to Accident and Emergency (A&E) at University Hospital Wishaw. After being initially assessed in A&E, he was admitted to the Emergency Care Unit (ECU).The next day - He was transferred to Ward 9.  
At the time, communication was lacking as we only found out that he was transferred after we turned up at ECU to visit him.Two days after being admitted – My daughter was called saying that he was fit for discharge from the hospital. She struggled to get him home using portable oxygenand no offer of patient transport was made. Upon arriving home, he collapsed again for a second time, this time in respiratory arrest. This meant another call to 999 for an ambulance and a return to University Hospital Wishaw A&E. He was subsequently transferred to Ward 8.Mid November 2022 – My brother was still in Ward 8.  
Neither my daughter or myself had received any communication from the ward about the future plans for my brother’s care, despite the fact that we were visiting him daily. Eventually when asked, a staff nurse informed my daughter that he would be discharged in 5 days and they had assumed that the family would be responsible for his ongoing care even though he had an existing care package in place prior to his hospital stay. Given the deterioration of his health and his mobility, we were concerned that his current level of care outside hospital was insufficient.Two days later, late on this evening (approx. 10:30pm), my daughter received a call from Ward 8 informing her that my brother was being transferred to Ward 6. This transfer was apparently because he was expected to be discharged. Days following move to Ward 6– During the night, he was awakened and transferred to Ward 18. As far as my family and brother were concerned there had been no changes to his health to warrant such a move.  
When my daughter arrived at Ward 6 to visit him, staff were unaware of who my brother was or where he was. This is appalling that family are not informed of their relative’s whereabouts within this hospital as it appears to be an issue with more than just one ward. Following the move to Ward 18, Doctors there determined that he was actually not fit for discharge. We wonder whether the constant upheaval over the weekend led to this decline.The next day – Suddenly, he was fit for discharge. He arrived home, this time by patient transport. He was home for around 15 minutes when he called me explaining that he was struggling to walk, frightened to fall and became incontinent. He was also sent home with diarrhoea.The next day – He was feeling unwell at home throughout the day. During his evening visit from his carers, he was violently sick despite not having eaten and they called my daughter concerned that he was having a seizure.  
My daughter asked his carers to call 999 for an ambulance immediately. Myself and my daughter rushed over where we found him covered in sick and then he had a further seizure while waiting on the ambulance. He was rushed in a blue light ambulance back to the hospital. Whilst in A&E, he had a further seizure and was extremely unwell. He spent the rest of the night in A&E and most of the following day whilst they tried find him a bed within the hospital.The next day – He was transferred to ECU in the late afternoon/early evening. I received a call from ECU informing that he was due to be moved to Ward 10, however this afternoon he was too unwell to be moved.Currently, my brother is still in hospital.Over the course of 22 days, he has been in A&E (x3), ECU (x2), Ward 9, Ward 8, Ward 6, Ward 18 and potentially Ward 10.  
We have grave concerns about the continuity of his care as he was moved so frequently and even greater concerns about the fact that he was discharged only to be brought back in an ambulance within 24 hours.This shameful treatment has contributed to a massive decline in his physical health and mobility. This experience has made the hospital feel like a revolving door and has been extremely unsettling for myself and my daughter.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Bob the Builder2356
title: Poor experience at the clinic
body: I popped in to the Stafford clinic to try and arrange an appointment for something I’m really quite worried about. Annoyingly it felt like they just dismissed me and said I had to call back instead of trying to help me out or reassure me which I found really frustrating.

author: Sandra49
title: Broken Ankle
body:
I would like to thank Gill and all the girls at the Ortho/Fracture Clinic at University Hospital Hairmyres, East Kilbride for all their kindness and fantastic help they gave me during my many visits. You all helped so much in keeping my spirits up during my long 8 week journey.  
Thank you all again.

author: trainsandrailways
title: Lengthy waiting times
body:
After investigating the possibility of autism, particularly the connection between autism and depression, in Summer 2022 I went to my GP and requested a referral to the Nottinghamshire neurodevelopmental specialist service. I'm a middle aged adult. I've been through a lot emotionally as I've worked through whether to ask for an assessment - looking at the impact this has had on my life, grief for what could have been different with better support, realising other people don't necessarily see the world as I do.  
I recently rang my GP to chase the referral and they said the waiting list is 30 months. Clearly the service is overstretched and underfunded! Really struggling with the thought of this wait. Also really disappointed that in a service where a high proportion of service users will struggle with uncertainty, I have received nothing personally to say my referral has been received, and had to actively contact my GP for an update on the length of a wait for an appointment.

author: Grateful365
title: My treatment following an accident
body:
Following a blow to the eye from my dying horse, I was in severe pain and unable to see from that eye. On arrival at the Accident and Emergency Department I was seen swiftly and made comfortable in a cubicle. My memory is sketchy, but I was seen by various doctors, consultants, attended the Maxillofacial Department, the West of England Eye Unit and had a CT scan.  
Throughout the day everyone was so compassionate, helpful and reassuring. Although not in the first flush of youth, I am embarrassingly not very brave in a busy environment, let alone in pain in a hospital, and upset at having lost a horse who I had had for 22 years. I am normally the person reassuring others!  
Everyone was so kind, although clearly busy, they checked me frequently and even cheerfully collected the frozen peas I had trailed from the pack I was using on my eye. Someone even managed to find sandwiches and tea for my poor husband, who is in his 80s and was understandably shocked by my predicament.  
I was diagnosed with a tripod fracture to my face, necessitating a repair to my orbital floor at a later date.  
Upon returning to the hospital two weeks later to undergo the orbital repair surgery, I was again treated very compassionately. As I nervously waited in the admissions ward, embarrassingly my legs wouldn't stop shaking, but everyone was again kind and understanding, and the anaesthetist came to administer something to ease my nerves. The anaethetists who looked after me were again so cheerful and understanding, chatting away to me and keeping me cheerful until I fell asleep. Upon waking in the recovery ward, the nurse who looked after me was again so kind.  
I spent the night on a ward as my eye needed hourly checks and I also required intravenous antibiotics to be administered during the night.  
I was discharged the following day and have had several follow-up consultations just to check on my recovery.  
My treatment and recovery have been nothing short of remarkable. Prior to surgery my eye had sunk, which upset those who saw me, and I suffered with severe double vision. Following surgery, I am now able to live my life normally and my eye now looks as it did before the accident. I am so eternally grateful for everything which was done for me and can never repay that debt.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: runningpc45
title: The best care I could ever have hoped for
body:
Had an operation at New Cross Wolverhampton. The consultants, pre op. care and theatre staff wonderful. I was then taken to ward D7 and had the best care I could ever have hoped for, it could not have been better if I’d have paid money.  
I give a big thank you to all who looked after me from admission to discharge. A wonderful team and you should all be given not only a pay rise but a great big thumbs up.  
HAPPY CHRISTMAS and NEW YEAR to all who work on D7.

author: Disebode
title: First appointment gastroenterology out patients
body:
Excellent experience at Out Patients Department (OPD) Gastroenterology.  
Hardly any waiting time. No television sets on or radios in the waiting area. Finally a clinician who was clear, had the skills to ask questions in a way that enabled him to elicit the information he required.  
It has taken months to get an appointment having relocated, worth the wait. My son had a positive experience which is so important.  
Easy to get a bus back (we don't drive.)

author: Julym44
title: Efficient and skilled team
body:
I am on chemotherapy for Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma so have a reduced immunity to infection. My dentist told me I needed an extraction. My consultant agreed for this to take place to avoid the chance of infection coming through a rotten tooth. Unfortunately the extraction didn't go well at my local dental practice and the tooth was left broken and in a far worse state than before the work began. I was in intense pain for a few days while a referral was made to a specialist and the risk of infection was high.  
Once at Treliske Hospital I was seen by an incredibly efficient and skilled team who cut the gum and removed the remnants of the rotten tooth. Although my chemotherapy treatment was interrupted I did not get an infection and the gum has fully recovered without any issues.  
The team, Surgeon Jamie , Senior House Officer Sacha and Dental Nurse Amber were a credit to Treliske Hospital and to the NHS in general.

author: Daffyduck
title: Frustrating visit
body:
I tried to visit a relative receiving end of life care last night and couldn't enter the hospital. I pressed every button I could find to gain attention but to no avail. This was over a period between 7:00 pm and 7:30 pm. I now fear I will not have the opportunity to say goodbye.  
As a community facility I did not expect it to be impossible to visit a dying relative, which deeply saddens me

readBy.name: Office of Alexander Burnett, MSP for Aberdeenshire West
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Heart attack? Me?
title: Forth Valley Royal Hospital
body: I had a heart attack while out walking. My partner took me to A&E, from where I was admitted to the Acute Assessment Unit, then moved to Cardiology. I was discharged today, and I am very pleased with the care I got in all three places. Friendly, helpful and kind staff of all grades and titles. Drs and Nurses knowledgeable and respectful, I felt cared for, listened to and heard. I'm vegan and my dietary needs were met. Thanks to everyone there for looking after me so well.

author: matarjx55
title: Active listening: a very helpful GP
body:
I went and had a face to face consultation with Doctor Katiya yesterday because I was having acute mental health problems. It was a complicated scenario to explain and Doctor Katiya understood the gravity of the situation. He was kind, incredibly patient and completely focused in on the issues in detail even though my obsessiveness must have been frustrating to endure. He made eye-contact throughout and I felt really seen. In the end he suggested very tactfully that rather than keep ramping up the situation he thought I should consider ‘de-escalating ’ the situation for the sake of my mental health.  
As I was at the end of my tether when I left I decided to take his advice I picked up the phone spoke to the person who was upsetting me who also listened and suddenly all the heat was gone out of the situation. We came to an understanding that in fact this was down to a miscommunication and now the drama and hopelessness are gone. A very wise piece of advice given with humility saved my relationship and life. I have hope again.

author: rlcarroll
title: Never contacted
body: Was referred to this department six months ago and they never contacted me. I've tried to call, but just get bounced between numbers, no other contact details, not even an email address. I was waiting to be assessed.

author: Tgreen
title: Excellent staff; Emergency Department and Acute Stroke Unit
body:
My dad took unwell at work, due to the quick timing of his work colleagues made his way to the Emergency Department (ED) in Hairmyres  
The ED staff were amazing and had him CT scanned and bloods obtained and reviewed very promptly despite busy pressures.  
He then was found after MRI to have had a stroke and was promptly taken to ward 6 the Acute Stroke Unit.  
The admitting nurse Michelle was fantastic and Dr Ibraheem was so kind he actually stayed past his shift to keep us informed of what was happening with his care. They then proceeded to do all the further investigations promptly over the weekend and he is now home waiting further review from Vascular.  
My Dad is usually from Ayr and would be seen at a different hospital and despite the distance I knew he was in very capable hands and wonder if he would have had the same care if he had not attended a hospital with a stroke department which Ayr does not have. In times when the NHS is heavily criticised for waits and insufficient care, I think it so important to praise them when they should be!  
Despite the stress the staff were all witty and kept my dad entertained.  
Thank you Dr Ibraheem, Michelle the staff nurse and all the staff at ED and ward 6!

author: Cloughreagh
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Truly grateful for everything you have done for me.
body:
Two weeks ago I arrived at Cloughreagh barely able to walk. Today I am leaving for home a different person with much more positivity and strength in my legs and back.  
I was delighted with the service and I became stronger as each day went by and I found I could do much more and gained a little more independence as each day passed.  
Thank you to everyone, including physio and occupational therapists for their time, patience and encouragement with getting me back on the road to recovery. I had never heard of Cloughreagh Home but me and my family are truly grateful for everything you have done for me.  
I hope everyone has a nice Christmas and some of you will enjoy a well earned break.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sagittajc88
title: Not 'just another patient'.
body:
From the age of 14, I experienced excruciating period pain which left me unable to function as normal. I was diagnosed with endometriosis at 18 and from that point forward, each monthly cycle was awful. Knowing I had this condition, I did my best just to 'get on with it', recognising my situation could be far worse.  
At the age of 40, I began to have regular break through bleeding, and my pain increased to the point I was having cramps consistently, whether I was having my period or not. I was referred to gynaecology to discover I had cervical erosion, and my consultant, Dr Inyang, was saddened to hear of my ongoing battle with endometriosis. Despite my appointment being purely to discuss any necessary treatment for my cervical erosion, Dr Inyang gave me the opportunity to really share how I was feeling. For the first time, I felt like I no longer needed to suffer in silence. I had options, and something could be done to help me.  
Fast forward a year, and I was given a hysterectomy which was nothing short of life changing. I had a quick recovery, and felt the fittest I had in longer than I can remember. However five months later, and I had been experiencing pain, bleeding and general discomfort. This was naturally a worrying time for me, and following a GP consultation, I was referred back to Gynaecology for further investigations.  
I received an ultrasound scan of the abdomen within two weeks of my initial referral which was wonderful. However the most outstanding part of my care has to be attributed to my gynaecologist, Dr Inyang, who has gone above and beyond from the outset.  
I was naturally terrified something was really wrong, to be experiencing this sort of pain and bleeding again. Dr Inyang understood my concern, and rather than having me wait for my results, he called me the following evening, to give me the outcome - which, I am delighted to say, was positive.  
The main reason for preparing this statement is to acknowledge Dr Inyang. He is approachable. He is professional. He is caring and compassionate. He saw me as an individual - not a number. Not 'just another patient'.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Most of the staff on the ward have been very good
body:
I have been on this ward for 4 ½ weeks. I came through the Emergency Department. I cannot remember much, but all I know is that I was there for 3 days. Most of the staff on the ward have been very good, I’m happy with the care I have received from the nurses.  
The communication with the GPs is awful, the consults are usually fine but the other ones who come up constantly contradict themselves. Some days they would come up and tell me I would be getting out tomorrow, then another person would say I wouldn’t be getting out until next week, so it’s very frustrating and confusing for me and my family, as I just want to be told one answer and not 10 different ones.  
I do not have enough room on the ward, I have been squeezed into a double side room on an extra bed with two other patients in the room. I have no privacy whatsoever, there’s not even a curtain around me, I don’t feel very comfortable.  
The food has been beautiful, it's first class, although a change in the menu would be good, as the menu is the same every day and after a few weeks It can get a bit sickening.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mikedb78
title: Surgical Procdure
body: I was very well looked after by David and Tara.  David told me exactly what was going to happen.  He expained things as we went along and told me what to do about aftercare.  I could not fault them on anything.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are amazing
body:
I came to this ward on Thursday after I spent one night in the Emergency Department. The staff have all been fantastic, I’m very pleased with the care I have received. The communication with the staff has been good, I just find it hard to make them out sometimes because I have hearing problems, but it's not their fault they try their best.  
The facilities are all grand, they're clean and they work well so that’s good. The food is fine, it’s not the best but it does the job.  
The other day, though, I was just given out my wash basin to wash myself in the morning, and then 2 minutes later the breakfast came round, so by the time I had finished washing my breakfast was very cold, maybe having a bit of a break in-between or even the staff could have waited until I was finished to hand it out.  
Although other than that the staff have been perfect, anytime I ring the buzzer they are quick to respond and I think they definitely deserve a pay rise, they're amazing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Annmr74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Patient care ward 40
body:
To all you wonderful angels who work so hard on the stroke ward.  
Thank you for your compassionate care.  
I am so grateful for the kindness I received on my recent stay on your ward.  
Have a happy holiday season, much love to you all.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Acute care at home
body:
_Story by 80+ year old male patient from Dungiven area:_  
I am very pleased with all the girls that came to my house. They were very good, and I couldn't say a bad thing about them. They are very friendly and good- I was glad to see them coming into my home. They always had a smile on their face, and I couldn't say a bad word about them. Thanks

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Acute Care at Home exemplary
body:
_Story by 80+ year female patient from Derry/Londonderry area:_  
The service provided by the Acute Care Team during my recent period of incapacity could only be described as exemplary, notwithstanding the shortcomings of the Western Trust.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: DJScott
title: Post Covid Syndrome Service
body:
I had a Zoom appointment with Tina to assess my symptoms. She was so helpful. The assessment went at my pace to allow me to think and take everything in. It was so good to get answers to a lot of concerns I had. Tina was extremely patient and so knowledgeable and understanding. I came away at the end of the appointment with a plan in place and so much information.  
It hasn’t taken my issues away, but it has certainly given me coping strategies to deal with them.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Tango2
title: Helpful and friendly team
body: I had my left eye operated on at the Vale of Leven Hospital yesterday. From the minute I walked in all the staff I encountered were extremely helpful and friendly. The Consultant Dr Connolly and her team performed the operation in a extremely professional manner and I am recovering quickly. I feel extremely fortunate to have had the cataract operation dealt with so well. Many thanks to everyone involved.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

links.id: very well looked after and safe

author: centaurusmc39
title: Extremely helpful experience
body:
Having been a patient at the Neaman Practice for almost 3 years, I can genuinely say it has been one of the most helpful and supportive Practices that I have ever experienced.  
The practice have been consistently helpful but I’d like to especially thank Corrin who quite literally holds the place together. Having visited the practice a few times now, I have been met with nothing but a warm welcome and fantastic rapport.  
I’d like to especially pass on my thanks for a recent story. I have just moved my ADHD prescription from my private psychiatrist to my NHS GP. The medication under the Shared Care agreement for ADHD is paramount to my daily functioning. Unfortunately my private psychiatrist had delayed in passing the info over and I was on the last day of my medication. I called the practice in a complete panic and rest assured, Corrin was able to work her magic. I had my medication within 18 hours (not even 24)! Honestly it may seem hyperbolic but the impact that these gestures of going out of your way to make someone’s life significantly easier are life saving. Even the reassurance from Corrin over the phone alone was enough to bring my sky-rocketing anxiety down to 0. The couple of minutes of conversation can be the difference between a good and a bad day for me, so the impact of this goodwill is a godsend!  
The relief and safety of having such a helpful team does not go unappreciated. In fact, many a time it has been the reason I have been able to function or not have a bad mental health episode - with medication!  
This is not the first time the team have supported me - it has been a consistent effort and unmatched level of support I am yet to see elsewhere. Even with the pressures GPs are under, I have never failed to be seen or to have gotten my medication in time even where I have delayed ordering thanks to the quick action by the team.  
Professionals such as Corrin renew the glimmer of hope in a field which has constantly faced an uphill battle. I am certain that Corrin doesn’t think twice before going the extra mile as it is second nature to her to obtain outcomes for patients. But I would at the very least like to convey that the impact on me as the the recipient has been invaluable.  
I am indebted to the support, care and kindness with which I have been treated with. Human compassion goes a long way - particularly with those such as myself who have battled with their mental health.  
Thank you so much to Corrin and the team for somehow managing to keep everything afloat. Community is so important at times like this and I hope my gratitude is passed on.

author: Dr.Mariam
title: Good labour experience
body:
I delivered my daughter in Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow.  
Six years ago, I had my son in the same hospital and had a horrible midwife that made my experience very traumatic, and I was dreading this the whole time in my 2nd pregnancy.  
This time my midwife was Nelly. Nelly was like an angel sent from God. She helped in every way she can, even the things she doesn’t have to do like carrying my bag to and from the labour ward.  
She is very compassionate about her job and took my labour pain seriously and offered pain relief options and answered all my questions to help me decide what is suitable for me.  
She helped me throughout my labour, guiding me through contractions. The whole process went smoothly unlike my first delivery, and I will be forever thankful for her and her efforts and won't forget her kindness and help my whole life.

author: Lass living in Glasgow
title: Breast lump
body:
As a 44 year old, I discovered a lump in my breast so phoned my GP. They saw me within a couple of days and referred me to the Breast Clinic at Gartnavel General Hospital less than a fortnight later.  
I was given a mammogram and ultrasound, which thankfully revealed a benign cyst. This was drained and I received another check before being discharged.  
Thanks for such swift and thorough help!

author: likeablepb44
title: Good care provided in Orthopaedic ward CAH
body: On behalf of our mother, we as a family wish to extend our gratitude for the excellent care and attention our mother received over the past 2 wks. All staff were kind and compassionate, however we would like to make particular reference to student nurses Arti and Lisa, who were professional, attentive, kind and patient!! We wish them well in their career as they move forward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: columbatp47
title: Dizziness
body:
I have twice mentioned dizzy spells to my GP, and both times was told the cause is too difficult to identify, so nothing was done.  
Recently my dizziness was much worse, and I took myself to A&E. The consultant said a physiotherapist is the best person to identify the cause and made me an appointment. Within the 1-hour appointment, the physio diagnosed the problem and resolved it.  
I realise the problem isn't always as easy to cure, but surely patients going to their doctor complaining of dizziness could straight away be sent to a physiotherapist. Maybe I could have avoided decades of problems.

author: correspondencehr47
title: Well looked after in the x-ray and scan department
body: Arrived this morning for my appointment to be greeted and supported by to wonderful gentlemen,(embarrassed to say I can’t remember their names) They both looked after me so well and put me at ease whilst having my bone mineral densitometry lumber and hips scan thank you for your kindness…..I don’t know why I was worried now!! 😁

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Our experience with the team was beyond excellent
body:
_Story by family member of 80+ year old patient from Derry/Londonderry area:_  
We would just like to say personally that our experience with the team was beyond excellent. Everyone's professionalism coupled with their kindness made our family's experience, at a very difficult and stressful time, a positive and appreciated one.  
Thank you from us all.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Colww35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Female Surgical
body: I was in ED for a long time, but it is not the doctors' or nurses' fault, it is the same in every trust. All the staff made me feel comfortable and could not do enough for me. I feel much better now and on the road to recovery and hopefully be home soon. The food could is OK, but could do with a bit more variety. Thanks to all the doctors and nurses for all their hard work and dedication in DHH.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: coinqc33
title: Багатодітна з України A woman with children from Ukraine
body:
Ми приїхали з міста Харків. Тікали від війни. У Північній Ірландії майже 6 місяців. В мене троє дітей, найменшому 3 роки. Нам дали ваучери і обігрівач. Підтримка відчувається на найвищому рівні. Коли ти залишив все, що мав і починаєш життя з 0, а тобі допомагають. Ти не один. Я дуже вдячна кожному, хто працює у цій організації  
We came from the city of Kharkiv. Fleeing from war. In Northern Ireland for almost 6 months. I have three children, the youngest is 3 years old. We were given vouchers and a heater. Support is felt at the highest level. When you left everything you had and start life from 0, and you are helped. You are not alone. I am very grateful to everyone who works in this organization

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Yamas
title: IPS future's Positive employment support
body:
After working for 11 years, my mental health (I have a diagnosis of Cyclothymia and Emotionally Unstable Personality Disorder) had deteriorated to the point where I had to quit my job. I took some months out of work, but eventually realised I need to have a routine and work is important to me.  
I tried to find employment for myself but failed as I could not sort out simple things like filling in an application form, arranging interviews etc, such was the degree to which I had suffered burnout. I registered for employment support through Dr Pathy at Millbrook Mental Health Unit, where I am an outpatient.  
Being able to meet regularly with Jordan (and previously Younis) made a world of difference, as their support to make sense of application processes and to help filling in a CV and application forms was vital in getting me back into being able to think about work. Having someone to talk to honestly about how I feel towards work helped to clarify what kind of employment is available to me and having a person who listens to how I feel about making applications etc means that I can address any issues that would have meant failure previously.  
The ordered and organised approach Jordan has taken has clarified things brilliantly and having her attend work interviews and be there to support me in communicating with employers has been vital in stopping me just giving up when things seemed overwhelming.  
I now have a part-time job to go to and working through a plan to survive at work and looking at what ongoing support I may need to succeed is invaluable for me as otherwise I will fail again as soon as there is an issue I can’t cope with.  
Without Jordan’s support and the resources she brings to me I have no doubt that I would not have continued to seek employment and there would have been a continued deterioration in my mental health.

author: likeablegk66
title: Пошук прихистку в Північній Ірландії Seeking refuge in Northern Ireland
body:
Я з трьома дітьми приїхали на навчання до Північної Ірландії. Діти вчили мову в літньому таборі, коли закінчився термін перебування на навчанні, ми повинні були повернутися додому, але в центрі допомоги українцям мені з дітьми запропонували житло та надали виплати на утримання, запропонували піти дітям до школи. Завдяки цим обставинам, зараз мої діти в безпеці, теплі та отримують освіту. Будь - яка допомога українцям дуже важлива і доречна в даний час. Дякую 🙏  
My three children and I came to study in Northern Ireland. The children studied the language in a summer camp, when the period of study was over, we had to return home, but in the center for helping Ukrainians, my children and I were offered housing and provided with maintenance payments, and they were able to go to school. Thanks to these circumstances, my children are now safe, warm and educated. All help for Ukrainians is important and appropriate at this time. Thank you 🙏

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Яна
title: Отзыв Review
body:
My daughter and I received moral and material support. This is a great help for all Ukrainians who find themselves in a difficult situation.  
We don't feel abandoned.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: alanat77
title: Compassionate Care in ward 10 UHH
body: My father recently passed away in Ward 10, University Hospital Hairmyres. The care he received was second to none. He was not the easiest, or friendliest, man to care for as it was his wish to die. Dr Clark and all staff in Ward 10 did not let his prickly demeanour get in the way. They cared for him impeccably and communicated regularly with myself and my brother. The staff went above and beyond looking after us during this extremely difficult time and I extend my heartfelt thanks to each and every one of them. I would like to also thank Kellyann for ensuring dignity and compassion in his final hours, and the nurse who looked after him the day before - sorry, I’m rubbish with remembering names! Keep doing what you all do, you are an excellent team!

author: Shynkevich
title: Helpful support in Northern Ireland
body:
In this center, they helped me with store vouchers. I was able to buy not only food, but also other necessary things for children and clothes.  
змогла зробити свято для дітей і вони почувають себе тепер на чужині краще  
I was able to make a holiday for the children and they feel better now in a foreign country

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ksu
title: Fleeing from Ukraine
body:
I'm from Ukraine.  I was forced to leave the country with my family because of the war.
It is very difficult for Ukrainians to adapt here.  People were forced to leave their homes, save their children, fled without things, without sufficient funds, with great pain and fear for loved ones and relatives who could not leave Ukraine.  Thanks to charitable organizations for their help, we really appreciate it, it is very important to us.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Drummer boy
title: I attended Stracathro Hospital Surgical for hernia repair surgery
body: My experience during my visit was exemplary, from the Surgery Unit itself to all the staff who cared for the other patients on the wards and myself. They were very professional and made everyone comfortable and reassured during the process. Many thanks to all.

author: Tetiana
title: Допомога українській родині Help for Ukranian families
body:
Я хочу подякувати Ukrainian Assistance Centre за допомогу, яку вони надають нашій родині протягом усього перебування в Північній Ірландії. Ми вимушено приїхали сюди із Харкова, міста на кордоні з Росією. З початку нашого перебування тут працівники центру завжди були готові допомогти нам. Ми неодноразово консультувалися з найважливіших і складних для нас питань у ситуації, що склалася.  
Окреме дякую я хотіла б сказати за подарунки, які ми отримали днями. Зараз, напередодні Різдва та Нового року, ми отримали подарункові сертифікати для придбання продуктів та інших товарів. А також олійний обігрівач для нашого будинку. Це дуже в нагоді. Наше захоплення не описати звичайними словами!  
Ми дуже вдячні центру за їхню роботу та підтримку.  
Удачі та процвітання вам!  
I want to thank the Ukrainian Assistance Center for the help they have provided to our family throughout their stay in Northern Ireland. We were forced to come here from Kharkiv, a city on the border with Russia. From the beginning of our stay here, the staff of the center were always ready to help us. We have repeatedly consulted on the most important and difficult issues for us in the current situation.I would like to say a special thank you for the gifts we received the other day. Now, on the eve of Christmas and New Year, we have received gift certificates for the purchase of products and other goods. And also an oil heater for our house. This is very useful. Our delight cannot be described in ordinary words!We are very grateful to the center for their work and support.Good luck and prosperity to you!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bookface
title: Multiple Emergency Department visits for medical problem
body:
I was unfortunate to experience repeated SVT's requiring many visits to my local Emergency Department for treatment to correct my heart rate.  
Despite staffing, workload volume and covid pressures, I was always treated in a timely manner and given first class care from the medical and nursing teams. I always felt cared for, informed in what was happening and supported with next steps.  
What I witnessed was excellent teamwork, great communication skills and essentially a fabulous team working under extreme pressures  
I am forever grateful to the ED team for being there when I needed them

author: mayjc87
title: Support for ukrainian childern
body:
We are family from Ukraine with a newborn baby and we appreciate that your centre contacted us. We took a part in a programme “Save the Children”/Save the Children Early Years Grants, and recieved vouchers and toys. We were happy to be able to buy our little girl all the necessary things, plus lovely toys and a first book which was sent directly to our address.  
It's very important for each family as ours feel supported in such good and safe place  
Thank you very much!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: rhinogq95
title: Went in for STI treatment
body: They made me feel very comfortable and reassured me not to be embarrassed and that there is no judgment. They had a look and tested me and then gave me an injection to treat it.

author: attendantex65
title: Rapid Assessment & Care Unit
body: The service was excellent, after being referred to CAU by my GP I was transferred to Rapid. I got the investigations I needed quickly and the staff couldn’t have been nicer

author: Gleissy
title: Removal of Mirena coil
body: I was able to get a last minute appointment on same day I rang. Lady who telephoned was super helpful and on attending I was seen quicky, treated with sensitivity and the procedure was completed very competently and efficiently.

author: Ukraine Girl
title: Ukrainian Assistance Centre
body:
Доброго вечора!  
Ми Українці,які втікали від війни до вашої країни. Нажаль не мали змоги взяти з собою багато речей (це було небезпечно). Пару днів назад отримали утеплюючий набір для бабусі. Дуже щиро вам вдячні! Набір дуже толковий і бабусі тепер тепло. Нам тяжко придбати все і образу,тому ваша допомога дуже актуальна!  
Також отримали набір дитячих іграшок,дитина дуже задоволена (іграшок в неї тут не дуже багато,тому це також дуже актуально).  
Дуже цінуємо вашу підтримку! Дякуємо мільйон разів!  
We are Ukrainians who fled the war to your country. Unfortunately, we were not able to take many things with us (it was dangerous). A couple of days ago, we received a warming kit for my grandmother. Thank you very much! The support is very helpful and my grandmother is now warm. It is difficult for us to buy everything so your help is very important!We also received a set of children's toys and our child is very happy (she does not have many toys here so this is very important).We really appreciate your support! Thanks a million times!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Nobody answers
body:
My son has very bad covid fever. I was trying to call them multiple times, waiting for longer than an hour. Nobody answers. 999 says that is not urgent, GP and A&E don't consult by phone and redirect to 111.

The service doesn't exist

title: Excellent and friendly practice
body: A very friendly and excellently run practice. Receptionists and all staff very helpful and know me personally.  Most consultations by phone with a wait for the call, but anything at all urgent gets dealt with immediately.  The doctor I see knows me well, and when something potentially worrying happened he saw me the next morning and got me in for a hospital checkup the next working day. I feel very lucky to be with this practice.

author: aquariusbf89
title: Excellent guidance
body:
Appointment with Krystle at the Health Centre physiotherapy for ultrasound on bladder relating to prostrate surgery recovery.  
Excellent guidance provided relating to cancer surgery both physically and mentally.

title: Really helpful practice
body: Doctor was really helpful and patient while I took my daughter's temperature, and our prescription was waiting for us at the pharmacy.

title: wound hub
body:
great service on time normally caring staff
they have no bother at doing what is needed
a very big thankyou

title: Good practice
body: The nurse was skilful and assuring. I did not wait long at the practice and they are generally quite helpful.

title: Great Service
body: I attended the Endoscopy Department at Queens Hospital Burton on Trent for a gastroscopy and was delighted with the service I received. All of the staff involved were extremely friendly, professional and took great care and time to guide me through the procedure and to explain the results  I don't believe I have ever been better cared for in a hospital environment.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor level of communication
body: My mother was in this hospital for 9 weeks & the communication has been very lacking since day one. No telephones are answered, messages not passed on, nurses or consultants not keeping family informed of treatments

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: This was my childhood GP practice and now it is my children’s GP practice. For over 30 years I have had an overall positive experience with the Doctors, nurses and reception staff. Time and time again I have trusted the medical staff with my most intimate and personal information and I feel I always get a high quality service. Unfortunately, on a few occasions my children have been extremely unwell and I have received quality advice, treatment and when needed referrals. Thank you all for your ongoing help and support when me and my family have need it most.

title: Car park
body: My Daughter in law took my Grandson for a procedure @podietry. He had to have his toe numbed before the procedure. When they got back to the car park it charged them £10. This is absolutely ridiculous!

title: Never heard a bad word about them!
body: A truely wonderful practice! Our children sadly have some health issues and the doctors and nurses have been kind and responsive. Theyve always responded amazingly quickly when contacted and been so lovely when we see them. We are so so grateful and feel so well looked after by them. Thankyou all at the surgery, youre worth your weight in gold!

title: Impossible
body:
After 35 minutes waiting I was cut off . 
I then had to resort to going to the a@e nearby for help. 
This is the 3rd attempt in a month ! 
Totally unacceptable!!!

title: Wonderfully caring
body: My 87 year old father was admitted to Heartlands Hospital via accident and emergency.  I cannot praise the wonderful caring and knowledgeable staff too highly.  Dad was looked after so well. Simply thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Rennmaus
title: Glasgow adult autism team
body: I can't fault the care and diagnostic experience I had here. The staff were very patient and have answered my and my family's questions as best as they could. I am already seeing benefits in my work and life as a result of being diagnosed and being able to access reasonable adjustments as a result, and we are so grateful for their help. Only thing I would like to improve is to have a visual map/diagram of the whole autism diagnostic pathway sent to everyone referred to the service - I feel this would've really helped me not get confused by the process. The adult autism team have told me they are working on this so hopefully this should be available for future referees.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: zebrajn65
title: RHC Day surgery unit ward 1A
body: My son was in this ward as he was going for surgery (fat graft). We were in for 24 hours and we received amazing care, both my son, my partner & I. From the nurses, support workers, students, clerical workers & the charity fun workers in the play area, they all made a very positive impact on the whole experience. A simple ‘how are you all feeling?’ made us all feel like our feelings were very valid. Amazing work from everyone and thank you so much!

author: whiskeynd88
title: This nurse really upset me
body:
I cannot praise the staff at Weldmar enough, they are caring, kind, considerate and made me feel important too as well as my partner, this was nice.  
District nurses, about 5 or 6 different ones, came to the house. Only one of them I felt didn’t do the job. My partner was laid in bed, dying of cancer, and this nurse just looked at me and asked so what can I do? The nurse said hello to her and then basically left – they didn’t do anything. My partner died a couple of days later.  
When I called the doctor to verify death, they said they didn’t know it had become this bad, they had been on holiday but was surprised no one had informed them on their return.  
I would have thought the district nurses had a duty to inform the patient’s doctor.  
This nurse really upset me, and I felt they gave no care to my partner or myself during this traumatic time. I had been caring for my partner for 2 and half years while she battled cancer.  
As I said, the other nurses were brilliant, and I couldn’t fault them, and Weldmar were brilliant can’t praise them enough.

readBy.name: Dorset Healthcare University NHS Foundation Trust - End of Life - Palliative Care

author: Grateful#7
title: Excellent care
body: Excellent care received with dignity, warmth and respect from Dr Panigrahy and gynaecology clinic team staff nurse Tina and care assistant Pamela. Professional, efficient and friendly atmosphere helped put me at ease and job done well. Very much appreciated.

author: Grateful#7
title: Brilliant job
body:
Attended radiology dept Crosshouse Hospital for an intimate scan. I felt quietly anxious but was put at ease by the room set up and staff attention to preserving dignity and privacy. Grateful to radiographer Margaret and the friendly radiology assistants who kept me well supported during the procedure. Lovely clean environment and nicely set up with privacy area for changing.  
I did not feel exposed and appreciated the caring gentle manner. Credit to all the radiology team who keep the service going and do a brilliant job despite all the challenging pressures we know NHS is under. Very grateful.

author: Louise736278
title: Sellers Ward, Chorley Hospital
body:
Absolutely appalling staff. Terrible services. After having major operation, the staff are quick to try get you out. I believe they were lying about medication that is supposed to be given and that a patient has eaten when they haven’t. I found the the night staff on Sellers terrible and rude.  
Why be in the profession if you don’t know how to treat a human with respect? Absolute disgrace, in my view. Making a patient feel uncomfortable and unwelcome when they throw a tantrum that the patient has to stay in longer than expected. My advice is to get new staff that actually care for other people’s health and wellbeing!!!

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Patient217
title: Maternity triage
body: I have pre-eclampsia and being seen every few days by various midwives in Wishaw. Was looked after today by a lovely midwife called Belinda. She was so nice made me feel at ease and can just tell she is very good at her job. Thanks for the reassurance keep doing what you do 😊

author: heart22
title: Gentle and professional
body:
Much to my surprise, as someone who had never used a gym, or exercise circuits before, I enjoyed the Fife Cardiac Rehabilitation Exercise classes.  
This was in large part due to the approach and personal styles of the two Physiotherapist/instructors who were cool, calm, gentle and professional, yet friendly. I felt that I trusted them.  
My only slight doubt came about at the initial assessment appointment, long before the start of the classes, when the person doing the assessment expressed some slight uncertainty about the correctness of the exercising pulse rate measurement. This was important since those measurements are used to set the target band for the pulse rate during the actual exercise classes.  
All-in-all I was happy with the classes and if I do some non NHS follow-up classes I will miss the presence of those individuals.

links.id: very well looked after and safe

author: Sweety
title: Day treatment
body:
I went Cannock Hospital as a day patient for a steroid injection in my foot.  
From the moment I stepped into reception to the moment I left, I was treated exceptionally well by all the nurses and theatre staff.  
They were so friendly I really didn’t feel like I was as in a hospital. I have spent a lot of time recently in various hospitals for myself or supporting family members, and if I was to recommend a hospital for any form of treatment it would definitely be Cannock Hospital.

author: reticulumzd65
title: Excellent care
body: I was a recent patient in ward 53 and was looked after by the charge nurse Lewis. He provided excellent care and really took the time to understand my needs and was there for myself and my husband after receiving devastating news.

author: G28
title: Antrim delivery
body: I gave birth to my son in October 2022. From walking into the delivery suite to leaving it, my husband and I were treated with respect and compassion. All the staff we encountered were so friendly and encouraging. My Midwife for the day shift was Louise, who immediately put me at ease from the moment we started walking down the corridor! I was anxious as this was my first baby. She provided us with information so we could make informed decisions and went through our birth preferences. We were able to have lots of laughs and chat. My labour progressed past her shift end, so Catherine and Jenny helped me in the final stages of labour. I needed a ventouse delivery in the end, and this was explained to me clearly and our son was born safely that night. Afterwards, Catherine and Jenny continued to look after us as a family, giving us valuable skin to skin during our golden hour and assisted me in my son's first breastfeed. I felt really at ease with all the staff and honestly had such a positive experience because of them.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lundin Jo
title: Day Surgery
body:
Day surgery for diagnostic hysteroscopy. Care was exemplary. Everyone made my stay as comfortable as possible. The anesthetist and surgeon explained everything and made sure that I understood what was going to happen. Aftercare was great. Plenty of time to recover and tea and toast given at the right time. Very pleased that the surgeon was able to come to the ward to give me the results from the procedure before I went home. I particularly appreciated the help given to book a taxi to drive me home.  
I was very impressed with the care that I got both at Queen Margaret Hospital and at the preceding outpatient appointments at the Victoria Hospital. I really can't think of anything that would have made things any better.

author: newmum02
title: Labour and delivery of first born
body:
As a first time mum, I’d just like to thank the QEUH Labour Suite - Ward 48 and Ward 50 - for the safe delivery of my son. From booking in to induction in ward, the staff were pleasant, helpful and supportive of my needs. I did have a wait to get into the Labour Ward, but through no fault of the staff and the Ward 48 staff kept me informed of what was happening with beds and when I’d hopefully be moved.  
Once on the labour suite, the midwife- Kate - was so calming, helpful and friendly. I trusted Kate completely with my care, she put myself and husband at ease. I needed a bit more help during the later stages of labour, but my baby boy was delivered safely by the team.  
I could tell that I myself needed a bit more extra help after the delivery, and the team worked efficiently, safely and quickly to administer medications, check the newborn and answer all my questions. I felt the team worked well together and I felt completely safe in their care.

author: orangebt83
title: My mother’s GP care
body:
My mum has been under the care of The Lea Surgery for many years, during that time the surgery has provide excellent care, treatment and support. All the staff from the Administration team to the Doctors offer a most professional service. When calling for appointments I have been offered times that work well for my mother and myself especially when visiting the surgery. My mother has seen several Doctors who have all been most helpful and thorough with my mother. The practice offered home visits and the district nurse when she could not attend the surgery.  
My mother has mobility problems and other age related issues the Surgery referred my mother to the local hospital for home care from physiotherapist which was a great help.  
Even during the covid lockdown the service offered was excellent.  
I wish to thank all the staff for the five star care for my mother over all these years. My mother is moving out of the area, we will certainly miss the Lea Surgery!  
Thank you very much - you are doing a great job.

title: Excellent Care
body: Today my appointment was speedy and completed with a really caring Team , I had had a very scary week leading up to my appointment but once I arrived everyone was so loving caring and understanding . It was very direct and was all over before I knew it . I had the news I was so hoping for and became extremely emotional with relief! The Nurse stayed with me after I had a procedure completed and only when I was ready walked me back to my husband . Amazing people from Admin to Doctors Specialist and Surgeons . Thank you all so much .

title: Excellent Medical Practice
body:
We wish to express our appreciation  for the empathy, understanding and support shown by all staff and the excellent Doctors at Fenham Hall Medical Group.
Whilst so many people only submit reviews for poor service from the NHS, we feel compelled to commend our doctor for his time ,obvious concern and expertise which resulted in him suggesting positive ways in our moving forward with a delicate and difficult issue . 
As a family, we are extremely grateful to everyone at the practice as you have always shown respect,discretion and genuine care and compassion during anxious times.

title: 5 star practice
body: On every occasion that I need to contact the surgery the receptionist have been amazing. They are kind, helpful, polite and caring. Even though the surgery is under alot of strain ,all staff have been brilliant.

title: Excellent service and care
body: I was referred to Tiverton for an Endoscopy and Colonoscopy. The 3 day prep for this procedure presents anxiety. I received excellent care and service in this small unit. Very efficient and every step was explained to me. A special mention to Katie who was with me at every stage. It is an unpleasant procedure but it was executed quickly and very professional. The theatre staff and doctor were very supportive to me for what is an invasive procedure. Thank you to all the staff

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Best Health Practitioners in the world!
body:
Quality of doctors, nurses and reception is high, I am sure Dr Graham had her input on that! That should be international standard for medical practice. Caring, professional, person centred approach. Amazing.
Through 9 years I had a chance to deal with Fairview Team on many occassions. High standard and support consistent

title: Great practice
body: I wanted to say I think Medwyn is a fantastic surgery. They are quick to respond with online queries and have always offered appointments when needed. The GPs are so helpful and thorough and the Practice Nurse Gillian is wonderful. I am a Practice Nurse myself so I understand the pressures everyone in general Practice is under but you'd never know it from Medwyn. Thank you for all your hard work!

title: Kind and considerate doctor
body: I had a good experience visiting the doctor. They took an interest in me as an individual and seemed to care about how I felt about the next steps of getting something checked out. I felt listened to and also happy that we’ve put the next steps to get a mole checked out just in case as there have been some changes to it.

title: Thank you
body:
On a couple of occasions I was able to get a telephone consultation and was seen face to face the same day. The doctor took my symptoms seriously and after several investigations found the cause. 
In consultations I was not rushed

title: Excellent team
body: I attended for a hysteroscopy today and the staff were wonderful. The consultant explained the procedure clearly, with diagrams, and the nursing and care staff performed their duties in a friendly and supportive manner. As my sister passed away this week, I was quite emotional and I really appreciated their concern. I cannot rate them too highly.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Good Practice
body: Average Response When You try and get Appointment Doctors Are Excellent And also NursesThey try and Do referrals  and Tests which needs Doing very Efficiently

title: Helpful staff
body: The doctor had asked for me to book a telephone appointment to speak with them. The staff were very helpful in arranging this especially with everyone being so busy.

title: Brilliant service and great doctors
body: Seen straight away if needed medical attention. If F2F is unavailable,  there is always the telephone call method and if the doctor on the phone is suspecting something, they make sure you are seen the next day.

title: Amazing service
body:
I completely a e consultation and had an email to say someone will contact me the next day, by 9am I had a text to confirm I had a fave to face appointment that day! Amazing 
And while I was there I got the system updated to a name change and saw the doctor who explained  what was wrong and what to do to sort it, I was talked through the treatment and a prescription was sent to my local chemist. 
Absolutely great service from Start to finish

title: Suspected Strep
body: Managed to get appointments for my husband, child and myself with suspected strep. Antibiotics given and follow up appointment for my son. Concerns were listened to and taken seriously. Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body:
Personally Called into the surgery last Friday lovely receptionist. Had a face to face with a well trusted family doctor on Sunday morning.
Again friendly receptionists. Thank you didn’t know this service was a available and very pleased with you all

title: One of the best doctors surgery in England
body: I’ve hand found all the receptionist very helpful very polite and caring every time I’ve had to make a call to them .and all the doctors working there go far and beyond all the time to help with the wellbeing of me

title: Exceptional care
body: Colonoscopies can be quite a stressful thought, more so as my partner died a few months ago making hospital visits very daunting,  but the whole team Receptionists,  Nurses and the Consultant were so caring.   I felt safe and protected.     Our NHS is incredible the compassion, sometimes under very difficult situations is extraordinary.   Dedicated people who want to help others.   Thank you

title: So helpful, a huge relief to find this GP practice
body: I recently moved to this GP practice. I can only say that I have found this GP practice totally helpful and supportive (they are so much better than the practice I transferred from).   The phone has been answered quickly each time I have called.   When I needed a prescription a GP sorted it within hours.   The staff are always helpful and polite. Another GP got me a hospital referral within weeks, I saw a specialist who diagnosed and prescribed and my health has improved already.  I had been trying to get help for that issue from my previous GP practice for 3 years.   Thank goodness for these people at Gower Street.

title: Efficient & Caring Environment
body:
My first visit to the rapid access chest pain clinic as an Out patient.
Welcomed and processed through on arrival.
ECG  ( extremely efficient & professional attitude)then assessed by a Cardiology specialist Nurse. So knowledgeable & reassuring.
This whole experience makes you realise how great is the NHS.
Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: In praise of a caring practice.
body:
I have regular treatment from the practice nurses who are consistently caring, competent and kind. I feel fortunate to be looked after by such nice people.
In addition, I have been treated recently by the practice doctor. Contrary to the popular perception nationally, I have found it to be quite reasonable to make a suitable appointment, and feel that the attention given to me has been professional, thorough, kindly and appropriate; drawing on additional resources as necessary.
I consider myself well cared for by the members of the Allan practice at the Calcot centre and I would like to record my appreciation. Thank you!
